Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 12.3 and σ = 1.3. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 10% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 10.0887
* 10.2082
* 10.4846
* 10.634

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 10.0887: Incorrect
* 10.2082: Incorrect
* 10.4846: Incorrect
* 10.634: Correct
